radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix is dilated and fluid-filled measuring up to 1.4 cm. There is extensive stranding within the mesenteric fat of the right lower quadrant. There is edema and thickening at the base of the cecum. Visualized lung fields are within normal limits. The liver demonstrates homogeneous attenuation throughout with no focal lesions. The pancreas shows a 3.5 x 4.0 cm centrally heterogeneously attenuating mass at the junction of the pancreatic body and tail. No appreciable fluid collection or extraluminal foci of air. Moderate atherosclerotic disease is noted.
